data: The text is arranged in two lines under the foot of the vase.
Found during excavations between approximately 1950 and 1980 in Gela, in the foundations of the archaic shrine.
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana
Gelas : storia e archeologia dell'antica Gela
R. Panvini, Gelas : Storia e Archeologia Dell’antica Gela, 1993
Iscrizioni greche arcaiche di Sicilia e Magna Grecia. Iscrizioni di Sicilia. I. Megara e Selinunte
Renato Arena, Iscrizioni greche arcaiche di Sicilia e Magna Grecia. Iscrizioni di Sicilia. I. Megara e Selinunte, 1st ed., vol. 1 (Milano: Istituto Editoriale Cisalpino - La Goliardica, 1989)
Inscriptions grecques dialectales de Sicile : contribution à l'étude du vocabulaire grec colonial
Laurent Dubois, Inscriptions grecques dialectales de Sicile : contribution à l’étude du vocabulaire grec colonial, CEFR 119 (Rome: Ecole française de Rome, 1989)
Renato Arena, «Παντάρηϲ ο Παγχάρηϲ?», Zeitschrift für Papyrologie und Epigraphik 63 (1986): 181–82
M.L. Lazzarini, ‘Note Onomastiche e Prosopografiche’, Rivista Di Filologia e Di Istruzione Classica 112 (1984): 327–37
The local scripts of archaic Greece
L.H. Jeffery and A.W. Johnston, The Local Scripts of Archaic Greece (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1990)
The Local Scripts of Archaic Greece
L.H. Jeffery, The Local Scripts of Archaic Greece, 1st ed. (Oxford, 1961)
Nuovi graffiti dagli scavi di Gela
P. Orlandini, ‘Nuovi Graffiti Dagli Scavi Di Gela’, Mitteilungen Des Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts (Athens) 63 (1956): 140–54
Πανχάρεός εἰμι καὶ το͂ν φίλο̄ν ϙοινά εἰμι

1Πανχάρεός εἰμι
2καὶ το͂ν φίλο̄ν ϙοινά εἰμι

1ΠΑΝΧΑΡΕΟΣΕΙΜΙ
2ΚΑΙΤΟΝΦΙΛΟ̄ΝϘΟΙΝΑΕΙΜΙ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text after Arena 1989 (IGASM I) ;
  • Orlandini, Jeffery, Dubois: Παντάρεος ;
  • Lazzarini: Πανχάρεος ;
  • Arena 1989: the iota of καὶ was initially omitted and was added in a later stage.

English translation

Valentina Mignosa

I am (the cup) of Panchares, and I am shared among (his) friends.

Italian translation

Valentina Mignosa

Sono (la coppa) di Panchares, e sono condivisa tra i (suoi) amici.

commentary

The inscription is written, according to Arena (1986) in the Megarian alphabet but was found in Gela. According to Jeffery (1961) the object may have ended up in Gela following the events that caused the conquest of Megara by Syracuse. It should be noted that the name Πανχάρες is recurrent in Megara Nisea, as Arena (1989) points out reporting parallels with IG VII 1-11, 12, 13, 42 and IG IV 926 (= IG IV 1[2] 71), and occurrs once in Akraiphia, Boeotia (IG VII 2750). The text, which denounces the name of its possessor, refers to its use during symposia.
